--- Joseph Reisinger <joeraii@...> wrote:
> So, for example take a 5x5 game board:
> 
> - - - - -
> - - - - -
> - - * * *
> * * * * *
> * * * * *
> 
> 
> The "-"s represent one half of the board, and the
> "*" the other. 

Okay...got it.

> No the code isn't available yet. Its not
> particularly clean, or well
> documented, and I don't have a lot of time to make
> it so now (I will
> probably over the summer if there is enough
> interest). If you need it
> before then, I can send it to you, and I can go over
> some of the
> implementation quirks with you. Otherwise just keep
> poking me and I'll
> make a public release.

Thanks for the offer.  But yeah, for now we're working
on a paper for GECCO as well, hopefully for inclusion
by the late-breaking paper deadline.  It's basically a
comparative study of complexification (additive
neuroevolution) and simplification (subtractive
neuroevolution) and both dynamics combined, all in the
context of NEAT.

But one of our next experimental goals includes
indirect encoding.

> I'm also very interested in an indirect encoding
> using NEAT, so I'd
> definitely like to see the results of such a
> comparison.

Yes...there are so many different possible approaches
to indirect encoding, it's an exciting area to
explore.

Derek
